From: "Piero Campanelli" <pierolists@...>

Hi,

I have found a solution to VaJava 3.5 and JUnit. It's
very simple !!!

QUICK SOLUTION:
You only need to:
  - right click on a project name in the workspace
  - choose  properties
  - enable "Extension Project"
  - Click OK

now run JUnit as a tool on your test suites or test classes...in that
project !!! It works as it worked in vaJava 2 or 3 !!!!

DETAILED SOLUTION:

Step1) under tools folder of VaJava create a folder called junit.
Then copy inside default.ini (from Junit distribution) and unjar
junit.jar inside it (it is not necessary to import JUnit into the
workspace folder)

Step2) restart VaJava

Step3) Set as Extension projects all the projects that you
want to use with JUnit tool (i.e. projects with your testcases !)
(In previous vajava you was used to setup workspace resource
instead !)

Step4) Run Junit :-)

NOW, I CAN SWITCH TO VAJAVA 3.5 :-)))))))

Hope this help,
Piero Campanelli
(pcampanelli@...)
subject: JUnit and VaJava 3.5: solution
